name: Sumire
info: A Sinner who is adept at breaking Cores. Deals Core Damage when casting an Ultimate. Does not gain Energy over time, but will instead recover 1 point of Energy per Normal Attack.
maniaIntensifyText: For each [Life Loss] state carried by the enemy, Sumire gains a 6% Damage increase against them.
criminalRecord:
Top assassin of the //Garden// who disguised as an ikebana artist and frequently appeared in high society circles. Assassinated multiple important politicians, entrepreneurs, and gang leaders. Involved in over a hundred murders in which all targets were killed by one critical attack. No clues about the subject's identity and whereabouts were ever exposed and the subject posed an immense threat to the safety of big shots in different domains.

--

The subject seems to have developed a strong infatuation with Chief. She obeys all orders by Chief unconditionally and is extremely stable in her detention. The subject has long quit //the Garden// and claims to have left all her illegal businesses behind. She plans to spend the rest of her life with Chief. Though her statement is hard to verify, judging from her behavior, she seems to mean it genuinely.
mutationAssessment:
+++* Ability Summary
Able to grant regular cold weapons range and power that defy all laws of physics with the stimulation of blood. Paired with her assassination skills gained from years of training and the //Garden//'s special umbrella blade, the subject can catch enemies off guard in battles.

+++* Awakening Signs
Awakened during the relentless training in the //Garden// in childhood and gained the Sinner power. The power was continuously enhanced during the subsequent years of assassination training and the subject is skilled in executing her special power.

+++* Corruption State
The subject has suffered close to ten years of prolonged corruption. Though no visible signs of mutation are observed, symptoms such as auditory hallucinations, headaches, and nightmares are frequent, suggesting rather severe corruption.
ecbFlavourText: "Along this path, there have been countless exiles, and I am one of them."
interrogation1:
As the Chief enters the interrogation room, this appears to be their first proper interaction with Sumire. Despite this, Sumire is very cooperative, detailing some of the Garden's history and surface-level workings for the Chief, as well as confirming that a few suspicious deaths of FAC employees were indeed carried out by the Garden. The Chief questions her about how such murders are conducted, to which Sumire replies that the Garden relies largely on the abilities of its Sinners. The Chief then asks if Sumire herself carried out these murders, which she calmly denies, implying that she only deals with commissions on a much higher level. The Chief asks why Sumire is willing to be so cooperative, wondering if she had a falling out with the Garden. Sumire assures them that she still loves and respects everyone in the Garden, simply that her presence within the MBCC could be considered as a warning. She claims that she doesn't have to worry about giving away this level of information because she believes in the strength of "The Mentor," the Garden's leader, who she feels confident could take down the FAC single-handedly. The Chief asks that Sumire reveal more of the Garden's secrets, hoping to prevent any unnecessary Sinners casualties at the hands of the FAC. Sumire comments on the Chief's frequent kindness, but apologizes, saying she is unwilling to betray the Garden's trust. The Chief tries to leverage that they won't be able to stop the FAC special commissioner from using methods like torture and truth serum, but Sumire replies that as one of the Garden's "creations," she will stay silent when faced with the FAC. "Besides," she says, "he might not be able to make it here." Nightingale informs the Chief that the Commissioner will arrive soon. Frustrated, the Chief takes their files and turns to leave, but an ornate letter slips out from between the papers. Sumire asks to see the letter, which the Chief allows, suspecting initially that it might have been misplaced by one of the staff members, but then sees that it is addressed to Sumire. As she reads, the Chief sees one sentence: "The return is nigh. Gather the flowers while you can." Sumire, for the first time, breaks from her calm and composed demeanor, looking shocked and going silent. As the Chief attempts to question her further, Nightingale interrupts over the comms, informing them that the FAC commissioner has been found dead. As the Chief departs, they vow to unravel the mystery behind the Garden, but Sumire remains silent.

The FAC Commissioner died of heart failure. Though the FAC suspects this is yet another murder done by the Garden, they have no evidence to prove it. You step in and help arrange things so the FAC will leave Sumire alone. After you are done with the tasks at hand, you plan to interrogate her once more.
interrogation2:
The Chief awakens from an ominous dream, finding a purple flower growing out of the back of their hand. Sumire is standing over them silently. Quickly deducing that she is here to kill them, they attempt to call for help, but are paralyzed by some form of neurotoxin. Weakly, they manage to ask Sumire about the contents of the letter. Sumire confesses that she had received orders to kill the Chief a long time ago - the letter was simply an ultimatum for her to finish the job. She tells the Chief a story from her childhood, through the lens of Nana, her birthname. She tells of how the Mentor recruited her to join the Garden, put her through rigorous training, and ultimately gave her the life she has today. The Chief tries to tell Sumire that the Mentor is using her, to which Sumire replies that she knows, but feels indebted to the Mentor for saving her life. Although allowing herself to be captured as part of her mission, she found that the Mania hallucinations that plagued her disappeared when she was around the Chief. She continued to observe them from a distance, growing to appreciate their approach to Sinners, their kindness, and eventually found that she was no longer able to bring herself to kill them. When she returned to the Mentor to report her failure, the Mentor did not punish her; instead, she sent more assassins to cover for Sumire's mistake. After repeatedly sabotaging attempts on the Chief's life, Sumire grew worried about how the Mentor would respond to her betrayal. As the Garden's top agent, she had hoped that the Mentor might harbor some sentimentality towards her, but the letter proved otherwise: it stated that if she could not complete this mission, the Mentor would do so herself. Sumire tells the Chief that she will leave the Bureau and personally ask the Mentor to revoke the assassination order, stating that meeting the Chief is the luckiest thing that's ever happened to her. As she turns to leave, the Chief manages to stand, but when they attempt to use the Shackles, they stumble and pass out. When the Chief comes to some time later, they see that the room is full of signs of fighting. Checking the security camera footage, they see that Sumire fended off another assassin and procured the antidote to the toxin, injecting it into the Chief and leaving moments before they woke up. Barely able to walk, the Chief uses the Shackles to sense Sumire's location, hobbling out of the Bureau in order to save her from what they assume is certain death.

The side effect of that toxic is taking its toll on you as you lose consciousness multiple times. But you understand how important it is to find Sumire.
interrogation3:
The Chief tracks Sumire to a large Japanese-style mansion, finding her kneeling in the courtyard and covered in blood. Two female assassins stand over her, and behind them, the Mentor is silhouetted from the other side of a paper screen. Sumire attempts to convince them that the Chief should not be killed, but the Mentor, having already noticed the Chief is among them, gives her one final chance at redemption. Sumire refuses again, then quickly rushes to block an invisible attack on the Chief, severely injuring her. Finally the Mentor acquieses, but demands that Sumire remain with them. Sumire tries to persuade the Chief to leave, but the Chief stands their ground and attempts to use the Shackles to attack the Mentor, only to have their arm disabled by another unseen attack. The Mentor gives them a chance to leave, but instead they choose to hold Sumire's hand. The Mentor asks if this is truly Sumire's decision, warns that she will eventually be betrayed, and the Mentor and the two assassins vanish as the candles behind the screen go out. With that, the Chief attempts to leave, but is too weakened to go any further. Sumire opens her parasol for the two of them and they sit beneath a white-flowered tree. The Chief comments that it feels like a dream, and Sumire encourages the Chief to rest, and that when they wake up, it will all be over. Sumire promises to protect the Chief, but the Chief insists that they will be the one to protect her instead. Before their consciousness fades, the Chief promises never to betray her. Sumire acknowledges, looks up at the sky, and says that the moon looks beautiful tonight. When the Chief wakes up in the sickbay, the memories of the previous day are blurred. With Sumire fine and the Garden seemingly laying low, the FAC closes the investigation.

The things that happened that night... you have no idea how much of it was true and how much of it was just an illusion. But what matters is that you are safe now.
arrestRec1: Before the arrest, the subject had long been a wanted criminal for a failed attempt to assassinate the Chief, but her whereabouts were elusive. Eventually, the subject was found unconscious and severely injured at the entrance of the MBCC, and was brought in to be treated, arrested and detained.
arrestRec2: Born in Eastside to unknown parents, the subject was adopted by the leader of the //Garden// and specifically raised to become an assassin. Members of the //Garden// addressed the leader as the //Mentor//.
arrestRec3: After a brief period of discreet activity as the assassin of the //Garden//, the subject debuted as //Sumire the ikebana artist// in high society. Thanks to her artistry in ikebana, she was fairly well-known among the upper class and had many fans. The subject was able to frequent important occasions with her forged identity which provided convenience for her assassination work.
arrestRec4: The subject had already quit the organization and ceased ikebana activity before the arrest. During the arrest, the corpses of several assassins also belonging to the //Garden// were discovered near the Bureau and were believed to be on the way to assassinate Chief. The wounds on their bodies matched the shape of Sumire's umbrella blade perfectly.
servingTerm1: The subject loves planting flowers and has planted various kinds of flowers in the garden to be used as ikebana materials. With extensive knowledge in plant care, barely anyone can top the subject when it comes to gardening skills.
servingTerm2: With old injuries accumulated from all the years as well as severe headaches and auditory hallucinations, the subject rarely goes out unless it's for executing battle missions. Despite that, the MBCC has never received any special medical requests from the subject. The subject claims that "she doesn't want the Chief to worry about her."
servingTerm3: Tea ceremony is another expertise of the subject's after ikebana. In her free time, she's almost never seen without a cup of tea in her hand. Her excellent tea-brewing skills have won her quite a few tea ceremony partners. Other Sinners are very welcome to follow the flower scent to her room and enjoy a tea-drinking session there as her guest.
servingTerm4: Every week, she takes a break from visitors for a day and focuses on ikebana. The final product will always appear on the windowsill in the Chief's office the next morning.
emotionCheck1:
[Sumire arrives at your office and wants to share your workload.]

**Sumire:** Chief... you seem troubled. If you don't mind, I'd be happy to share your burden.

**Chief:** ……

* **Prompt:** If you insist, you can help me move these documents.
 * **Sumire:** Okay, I get it. I'll work hard.
 * **Sumire:** 😖

* **Prompt:** Actually, there isn't anything I'm upset about. I'm fine.
 * **Sumire:** Do you... not trust me?
 * **Sumire:** 😫
emotionCheck2:
[Sumire holds a petal but looks worried.]

**Sumire:** The killers of the Garden... were here lately?

**Chief:** ......

* **Prompt:** It’s okay. This place is quite safe.
 * **Sumire:** Please… watch yourself out there. They can be everywhere
 * **Sumire:** 😫

* **Prompt:** If you are so worried, I’ll have you as my guard.
 * **Sumire:** I will never let you down.
 * **Sumire:** 😘
supervision1:
++* ⚠ Fiction And Reality

//Sumire is reading a novel.//

**System Notifications:** Sumire is reading a novel which tells the story of an assassin falling in love with her target.

* **Prompt:** Ask for her thoughts

**Sumire:** Other than the details of the mission operation, the rest is all very realistic.
supervision2:
++* ⚠ Ikebana Work

//You received a notification from Faye.//

**System Notifications:** Faye told you that someone out there is offering a great price to buy Sumire's works from the MBCC.

* **Prompt:** Ask Sumire's thoughts

**System Notifications:** Sumire accepted the offer without hesitation.
supervision3:
++* ⚠ Massage

//You have been feeling weary lately and decided to enjoy some movie in the Recreation Area.//

**System Notifications:** You have been feeling weary lately. Sumire offered to give your head a massage.

* **Prompt:** Approve

**System Notifications:** You feel that your working efficiency suddenly improved significantly.
supervision4:
++* ⚠⚠ Decorative Items

//You wanted to add some decorative items to your office and decided to ask Sumire for help.//

**System Notifications:** You wanted to add some decorative items to your office and decided to ask Sumire for help.

**Sumire:** Chief, what did you ask me here for?

* **Prompt:** Inform of the needs

**Chief:** Take a seat. I asked for you because... well, I'd like to decorate the office. Add some flowers, perhaps?

**System Notifications:** I see. Some of the guests said that this place felt too depressing, so you'd like to plant some flowers.

**Sumire:** I see.

**Sumire:** In that case, which type of style do you prefer?

* **Prompt:** Type of style?

**Sumire:** For different schools of flower arrangement, there are different design styles.

**Sumire:** I'm familiar with three schools of flower arrangement. The Ikenobo school focuses on the flowers themselves, while the Ohara school brings out the colors and views. And the Sogetsu school is more natural, atmospheric and loose...

* **Prompt:** Let Sumire decide

**Chief:** I don't understand any of what you just said, so I guess I'll just go with the flow and follow your aesthetics, Sumire.

**Sumire:** Yes, as you wish. I will create a beautiful piece of art that suits you.
supervision5:
++* ⚠⚠ Tea Drinking

//Sumire is in a regular hypnotherapy session.//

**System Notifications:** Sumire raised her head, her eyes fixated on you.

* **Prompt:** Greet

**Chief:** Hello, Sumire.

**Sumire:** Are you busy right now?

**Chief:** Not really.

**Sumire:** You've always been hard at work. Now that you have some time to spare, what do you say you sit down and have some tea?

**Chief:** Do you like making tea?

**Sumire:** Not by a lot.

**Sumire:** At the end of the day, tea is but a way to host guests. If I could choose, I didn't want so many "guests."

**Chief:** So, am I intruding here...?

**Sumire:** You are an exception to me.

**Sumire:** I can learn any art in this world for you, as long as you wish.

* **Prompt:** ...

**Chief:** I... uh...

**Sumire:** The tea is ready. Here.
supervision6:
++* ⚠⚠⚠ No Reasons Needed

//Sumire once again protects you in a simulated practice battle.//

**System Notifications:** In a simulated practice battle, Sumire is once again assessed with a heavy injury in order to protect you.

* **Prompt:** Check on Sumire

**Chief:** Sumire, please protect yourself on the battlefield. Don't take such big risks for me.

**Sumire:** I'm sorry, Chief, but I'm afraid that's the only thing I'm incapable of doing.

* **Prompt:** Ask why
 * **Chief:** Why?
 * **Sumire:** It's a tough question to answer... To the present me, the greatest purpose of my existence is to guarantee your safety.
 * **Sumire:** And this feeling doesn't require any reason. No one knows why cherry blossoms are pink and why peonies are red. Beauty requires no reason. Perhaps it's the same for love.
 * **System Notifications:** Your cheeks are warming up.
 * **Sumire:** Apologies, I've misspoken.
 * **System Notifications:** Seeing your reaction, Sumire tugs at her sleeves and bows her head slightly.
 * **System Notifications:** If certain things really don't need reasons, it should be true the other way round too. You decide to respond to Sumire with your action.
 * **Chief:** Keep on training. I won't hold my Sinner back.

* **Prompt:** Insist
 * **Chief:** This is an order.
 * **Sumire:** An order? But even if it's your order, I probably won't obey it.
 * **Sumire:** Chief, don't forget that I'm an assassin. The most important quality of an assassin is to trust her own judgment.
 * **Sumire:** Whatever it costs, I will protect you. This doesn't require any reason and won't be stopped by anything.
 * **Sumire:** Please trust my judgment.
 * **Chief:** ...
 * **Chief:** Keep on training. Next time, I'll be the one protecting you.
baseVoicelines:
[Obtain the Sinner]
At last, we meet again... Sumire is the name of this flower, it's also my name. It'd be my pleasure if you'd accept this as a gift.

[Raise to Phase 1]
The deeper the roots, the more beautful the flowers will be... Deadlier, too.

[Raise to Phase 3]
This body of mine has bloomed. From this day on, I will be a sharp blade that only you could wield.

[Level Start]
Stay close to me.

[Win Battles]
The victory belongs to you.

[Lose Battles]
This is all my fault, this is all my fault...

[Ultimate Skill]
Cherry blossoms are falling... And so will you!

[Die in Battles]
I'm sorry, farewell...

[Greeting]
Look, Chief, the tea leaves are standing. Could it be that pleasant surprises are awaiting us?

[Conversation 1]
Cut off living flowers, arrange them in shapes desired by humans, admire their elegance as they die... That is the art of ikebana. Sounds cruel, doesn't it?

[Conversation 2]
It's incredibly easy to kill a person. Too easy. Living, on the contrary, is hard...

[Conversation 3]
How enviable, the flowers are always thriving towards the sun. Me, I'm just a vermin hiding in the shadow... I don't live up to my own name.

[Special Conversation 1]
Only as we part do I know, men perish, as flowers do.

[Special Conversation 2]
How extraordinary, being with you makes me want to believe in dreams, future and hope... Perhaps I'm no longer qualified to be an assassin.

[Special Conversation 3]
Since the first time I'd picked up a weapon, I'd never dared to dream of going back, until I met you... Promise me you'll never leave me, please.

[Full Compliance]
I used to think it was already more than enough to just be next to you. It turns out that I'm far greedier than I thought.

[Idle]
Are you asleep, Chief? You must be exhausted... Once I seize a chance, I'll get rid of those guys who are in your way. When that's done, you can have a good night's sleep, alright?

[Annoyed]
We're still at work, Chief...

[Special Attention]
You're always busy dealing with others' problems, but you must have your own worries too, don't you? If you don't mind, please let me be your listener.

[Dispatch]
Along this path, many have come and gone, and I am one of them.

[Dispatch Complete]
Birds return to their nests, as wilted flowers rejoin fallen leaves.

[Level Up]
The flowering season is nearing.
attireVoicelines1:
[Attire Obtained]
Thank you for coming... The cherry blossoms are especially beautiful this year, so I couldn't help but want to enjoy this scenery with you.

[Greeting]
You're not late. It was me who arrived early at the thought of seeing you... Don't worry, I was not bored at all, because I was just so happy to meet you soon.

[Ordinary Contact 1]
Only by chossing the right materials for flower arrangements and wearing the right clothes to view the cherry blossoms, shall one live up to the beauty of nature. So, what do you think of my outfit, Chief?

[Ordinary Contact 2]
Cherry blossoms are also known as the "Flower of Fantasy", because they are as beautiful and illusory as dreams... much like this moment. The time spent with you is as intoxicatingly beautiful as a cherry blossom. Even if it's as fragile and fleeting as a dream, I'm content.

[Ordinary Contact 3]
Come sit next to me. If you don't mind, you can take a nap on my lap, I'll hold the parasol over you...

[Ordinary Contact 4]
Three days since I last held your hand, now cherry blossoms have covered the land. People often quote this poem to express the passing of time... I wonder when I'll ever get to go out with you again?

[Idle] 
Did you see that? The butterfly that just flew by had a petal on its wing...

[Special Attention] 
You keep looking at me and not at the cherry blossoms... Do you want to say something to me?

[Level Up}
Cherry blossoms are willing to bloom passionately for their admirers until the end of their lives, and so do I.

[Pat Head]
... What's wrong? There are petals on my face? (Blushing) How embarassing. Thank you for taking them off me.
attireVoicelines2:
[Attire Obtained]
Thank you for coming to enjoy this beautiful view with me... I'm certain that, each night after this night, whether it's bright or dim, or wax or wane, I will think of tonight, and the moon we enjoyed together.

[Greeting]
The moon hidden in the clouds just peeks out. Do you think it also awaits this romantic encounter with us here and now?

[Ordinary Contact 1]
"The moon, alas, is no drinker of wine." Chief, how about I tell you a story unique to a moonlit night?

[Ordinary Contact 2]
When I was little, I once heard about a rumor that foxes often transform into humans when the moonlight is bright, and invite the fateful ones to stroll with them... Hmm? Do you think I'm a fox?

[Idle] 
Alone are the leaves and moon. Alone I hum the wistful tune.

[Annoyed]
Emm, it it getting windy? Allow me, Chief. I don't want you to catch a cold.

[Special Attention] 
If you only gaze at the moon, you might overlook the scenery that truly matters.

[Level Up}
In the sameness of all nights, your kind words made this one incomparable.
nightmareTalent: All allied Sinners gain a 15% [Life Loss] damage boost.

exclusiveCrimebrand.name: Lethal Blossom
exclusiveCrimebrand.description: Increases the damage coefficient of all [Life Loss] on the battlefield by 20% / 25% / 30%.
exclusiveCrimebrand.flavourText: "Along this path, there have been countless exiles, and I am one of them."

maniaIntensify.title: Post-Victory Momentum
maniaIntensify.text: For each [Life Loss[ state carried by the enemy, Sumire gains a 6% damage increase against them.

guide.title: Summary
guide.text: Sumire is a core member of the [Life Loss] composition, also known as the "Bleed team". For more information on this comp, please refer to Yjndae's Bleed guide.

guide.title: Crimebrands
guide.text: For an explanation of which Crimebrands to pick for Sumire, please see Yjndae's Bleed guide linked at the top of this page.

pros: Decent personal dmg in bleed team
cons: Not useful outside of bleed team
Needs to NA to gain energy

shackles.title: Come Up Roses
shackles.description: Every attack reduces the cooldown of [Crazed Sakura] by 1 second.

shackles.title: Emotion Resonance
shackles.description: Ultimate Energy Consumption reduced by 3 points.

skills.name: Umbrella Blade
skills.description: Sumire attacks with her umbrella, dealing (Attack*68%) Physical Damage.

skills.name: Impermanence
skills.description: Sumire blinks to the target grid, dealing (250% of her Attack) Physical Damage to all enemies in the 4 grids ahead for 2 times, with 1 Core Damage each time.

skills.name: Crazed Sakura
skills.description:
Every 16 seconds, Sumire rapidly stabs all enemies 6 times in the 2 grids ahead, each stab dealing (20% of her Attack) Physical Damage and attaching [Life Loss] mark.
[Life Loss]: Deals (45% of Sumire's Attack) Physical Damage per second, lasts for 8 seconds.

upgrade.description:
Spike Damage is increased to $0%.
[Life Loss] damage is increased to $0%.

skills.name: Flower Silhouette
skills.description: Sumire gains 10% Damage Bonus to enemies if an ally is in the grid ahead of her.

compliance: Unlock File: Performance in Serving Terms, Attack +5
Unlock Voice: Special Conversation 1, Attack +6, Unlock Requirementss: Use non-assistant Sumire's nirvana 30 times
Unlock File: Performance in Serving Term
Unlock Voice: Special Conversation 3, Unlock Requirements: Complete Sumire's Review
Unlock Voice: Full Compliance, and the title is unique

voicelines.Obtain the Sinner - EN: At last, we meet again... Sumire is the name of this flower, it's also my name. It'd be my pleasure if you'd accept this as a gift.
voicelines.Obtain the Sinner - JP: やっとお会いできましたね……菫、それは花の名であり、わたしの名でもあります。よろしければ、どうぞお受け取り下さい。
voicelines.Obtain the Sinner - KR: 드디어 또 뵙게 되었습니다. 진… 제비꽃이라는 뜻이지요. 이 꽃의 이름이자 제 이름입니다. 괜찮으시다면 받아주세요.
voicelines.Obtain the Sinner - CN: 终于，又见到您了……堇，是这朵花的名字，也是我的名字。不介意的话，请您收下它吧。
voicelines.Obtain the Sinner - TW: 終於，又見到您了……堇，是這朵花的名字，也是我的名字。不介意的話，請您收下它吧。
voicelines.Raise to Phase 1 - EN: The deeper the roots, the more beautiful the flowers will be... Deadlier, too.
voicelines.Raise to Phase 1 - JP: 根を地面に深く伸ばす花ほど美しく咲き誇り……そして命を奪うのです。
voicelines.Raise to Phase 1 - KR: 뿌리를 깊이 파묻을수록 피어나는 꽃은 더 아름답고… 치명적인 법이지요.
voicelines.Raise to Phase 1 - CN: 根埋得越深，开出的花才能更加美丽……更加致命。
voicelines.Raise to Phase 1 - TW: 根埋得越深，開出的花才能更加美麗……更加致命。
voicelines.Raise to Phase 3 - EN: This body of mine has bloomed. From this day on, I will be a sharp blade that only you could wield.
voicelines.Raise to Phase 3 - JP: この身は、すでに咲き誇っています。これからは、貴方様だけの刃になると誓いましょう。
voicelines.Raise to Phase 3 - KR: 이 몸은 활짝 피었어요, 오늘부터 저는 당신만의 칼날입니다.
voicelines.Raise to Phase 3 - CN: 此身，已然盛放。从今往后，我便是您一个人的利刃。
voicelines.Raise to Phase 3 - TW: 此身，已然盛放。從今往後，我便是您一個人的利刃。
voicelines.Win Battles - JP: これは貴方様の勝利です。
voicelines.Lose Battles - EN: This is all my fault, this is all my fault...
voicelines.Lose Battles - JP: すべてはわたしの……わたしのせいです……
voicelines.Lose Battles - CN: 都是我的错，都是我的错……
voicelines.Lose Battles - TW: 都是我的錯，都是我的錯……
voicelines.Ultimate Skill - EN: Cherry blossoms are falling... And so will you!
voicelines.Ultimate Skill - KR: 벚꽃이 지면… 당신의 목숨도 지게 될테니!
voicelines.Die in Battles - JP: 申し訳ありません。永遠のお別れです……。
voicelines.Greeting - EN: Look, Chief, the tea leaves are standing. Could it be that pleasant surprises are awaiting us?
voicelines.Greeting - JP: 局長様、見てください。茶柱が立っています。これは意外な幸運が訪れるかもしれませんね。
voicelines.Greeting - KR: 국장님, 이것 좀 보십시오. 찻잎이 서있으니 뜻하지 않은 좋은 일이 생길지도 몰라요.
voicelines.Greeting - CN: 局长您看，茶叶立起来了，说不定会有意想不到的好事发生呢。
voicelines.Greeting - TW: 局長您看，茶葉立起來了，說不定會有意想不到的好事發生呢。
voicelines.Conversation 1 - EN: Cut off living flowers, arrange them in shapes desired by humans, admire their elegance as they die... That is the art of ikebana. Sounds cruel, doesn't it?
voicelines.Conversation 1 - JP: まだ命のある花の枝を切り、人間の意志通りに形づくり、死に行く花の最期の優雅さを楽しむ……これが華道です。酷いものでしょう？
voicelines.Conversation 1 - KR: 살아 있는 꽃가지를 잘라서, 인간이 원하는 대로 여러 가지 모양으로 꾸민 후, 그들의 죽기 전 그 우아함을 감상한다… 이게 바로 화도예요, 참 잔인하게 들리죠?
voicelines.Conversation 1 - CN: 将活着的花枝剪下，按照人类的意愿，摆出各种造型，欣赏它们死前的优雅……这就是花道，听起来很残忍吧？
voicelines.Conversation 1 - TW: 將活著的花枝剪下，按照人類的意願，擺出各種造型，欣賞它們死前的優雅……這就是花道，聽起來很殘忍吧？
voicelines.Conversation 2 - EN: It's incredibly easy to kill a person. Too easy. Living, on the contrary, is hard...
voicelines.Conversation 2 - JP: 命を奪うのはあまりにもたやすいことです。それに比べ、生きることは難しいですわ。
voicelines.Conversation 2 - KR: 사람을 죽이는 것은 너무 쉬운 일입니다. 반대로, 살아가는 것이야말로 정말 힘든 일이죠.
voicelines.Conversation 2 - CN: 要伤害一个人实在是太过容易了。相比而言，活着才是更加艰难的事情吧。
voicelines.Conversation 2 - TW: 要殺死一個人實在是太過容易了。相比而言，活著才是更加艱難的事情吧。
voicelines.Conversation 3 - EN: How enviable, that flowers are always thriving towards the sun. Me, I'm just a vermin hiding in the shadow... I don't live up to my own name.
voicelines.Conversation 3 - JP:
太陽のもとで生きられるなんて、花はなんとうらやましいものでしょう。わたしなど、影に潜む毒虫に過ぎません……
「菫」という名前はわたしには勿体なさ過ぎますね。
voicelines.Conversation 3 - KR: 꽃이 참 부럽습니다. 양지바른 곳에서 태어나 자라는 것이… 저는 그저 어두운 그림자 속에 숨어있는 독충에 지나지 않는 것을… 저는 근본적으로 이 이름에 어울리지 않습니다.
voicelines.Conversation 3 - CN: 真叫人羡慕啊，花能够向阳而生。而我，不过是躲在阴影中的毒虫……我根本配不上这个名字。
voicelines.Conversation 3 - TW: 真叫人羨慕啊，花能夠向陽而生。而我，不過是躲在陰影中的毒蟲……我根本配不上這個名字。
voicelines.Special Conversation 1 - EN: Only as we part do I know, men perish, as flowers do.
voicelines.Special Conversation 1 - JP: 花も人も、失ってからその大切さがわかるのです。
voicelines.Special Conversation 1 - KR: 사람들은 종종… 익숙함에 속아 소중함을 잊지.
voicelines.Special Conversation 1 - CN: 别时方知此世中，花亦花来人亦人。
voicelines.Special Conversation 1 - TW: 別時方知此世中，花亦花來人亦人。
voicelines.Special Conversation 2 - EN: How extraordinary, being with you makes me want to believe in dreams, future and hope... Perhaps I'm no longer qualified to be an assassin.
voicelines.Special Conversation 2 - JP: 貴方様と一緒にいると、わたしまで夢や未来、そして希望を信じるようになりました……もはや殺し屋失格です。
voicelines.Special Conversation 2 - KR: 당신과 함께 있으면서 저도 꿈을 믿기 시작했습니다. 미래도, 희망도… 어쩌면 저는 더 이상 킬러가 될 자격이 없겠지요.
voicelines.Special Conversation 2 - CN: 和您待在一起，我居然也开始相信梦想、未来和希望了……或许我没有资格回到过去了吧。
voicelines.Special Conversation 2 - TW: 和您待在一起，我居然也開始相信夢想、未來和希望了……或許我沒有資格再成為一名殺手了吧。
voicelines.Special Conversation 3 - EN: Since the first time I'd picked up a weapon, I'd never dared to dream of going back, until I met you... Promise me you'll never leave me, please.
voicelines.Special Conversation 3 - JP: 初めて武器を手にした時、もう戻れないと覚悟しました。貴方様に出会うまでは……これだけは約束してください。わたしから、決して離れないで。
voicelines.Special Conversation 3 - KR: 처음 무기를 드는 순간, 전 다시는 돌아설 거라는 걸 바라지 않았어요. 당신을 만날 때까지는… 약속해 주세요 … 날 떠나지 않겠다고.
voicelines.Special Conversation 3 - CN: 在第一次拿起武器时，我便再没有奢望过回头。直到遇见您……请，答应我，不要离开我。
voicelines.Special Conversation 3 - TW: 在第一次拿起武器時，我便再沒有奢望過回頭。直到遇見您……請，答應我，不要離開我。
voicelines.Full Compliance - EN: I used to think it was already more than enough to just be next to you. It turns out that I'm far greedier than I thought.
voicelines.Full Compliance - JP: 傍に居るだけで満足だったのですが……わたしは自分が思っているよりも貪欲なようですね。
voicelines.Full Compliance - KR: 저는 그저 당신 곁에만 있을 수 있다면 만족할 줄 알았습니다. 하지만 저는 생각보다 욕심이 많았어요.
voicelines.Full Compliance - CN: 我原本以为，只要能待在您身边，我就心满意足了。但事实上，我远比自己想象得要贪心呢。
voicelines.Full Compliance - TW: 我原本以為，只要能待在您身邊，我就心滿意足了。但事實上，我遠比自己想像得要貪心呢。
voicelines.Idle - EN: Are you asleep, Chief? You must be exhausted... Once I seize a chance, I'll get rid of those guys who are in your way. When that's done, you can have a good night's sleep, alright?
voicelines.Idle - JP: 局長様？お休みになられてしまったのですか？ お疲れなのですね……機会を見て邪魔な者は排除します。その時はもっとゆっくりお休みくださいね。
voicelines.Idle - KR: 국장님, 주무셨습니까? 분명 또 과로하셨을 테지요… 제가 기회를 봐서 귀찮게 하는 녀석들을 다 제거해 드릴 테니 국장님은 편히 주무십시오.
voicelines.Idle - CN: 局长，您睡着了吗？一定是累坏了……我会找机会解决掉那些麻烦的。到时候，您就能好好休息了吧。
voicelines.Idle - TW: 局長，您睡著了嗎？一定是累壞了……我會找機會除掉那些礙事的傢伙的。到時候，您就能好好休息了吧。
voicelines.Annoyed - JP: 局長様、まだ仕事の時間ですよ……。
voicelines.Annoyed - CN: 局长，现在还是工作时间哦……
voicelines.Annoyed - TW: 局長，現在還是工作時間哦......
voicelines.Special Attention - EN: You're always busy dealing with others' problems, but you must have your own worries too, don't you? If you don't mind, please let me be your listener.
voicelines.Special Attention - JP: 局長様はいつも自分のことは二の次なのですね。貴方様にも悩み事があるでしょうに。わたしでよければ、話を聞かせてください。
voicelines.Special Attention - KR: 국장님은 늘 남의 일만 열심히 해주시는데, 당신도 나름의 걱정거리가 있겠지요? 싫지 않으시다면 제가 당신의 걱정을 나누어 드려도 되겠습니까?
voicelines.Special Attention - CN: 局长总是在为别人的事奔波，您也会有自己的烦心事吧？如果不嫌弃的话，请让我为您分忧吧。
voicelines.Special Attention - TW: 局長總是在為別人的事奔波，您也會有自己的煩心事吧？如果不嫌棄的話，請讓我為您分憂吧。
voicelines.Dispatch - EN: Along this path, many have come and gone, and I am one of them.
voicelines.Dispatch - JP: この道を、行き来する者は数え切れぬほど。わたしもまたその一人。
voicelines.Dispatch - KR: 무수히 많은 이가 이 길을 오가고, 나 역시 그 속에 있으니…
voicelines.Dispatch - CN: 此番路，来去无数，我亦在其中。
voicelines.Dispatch - TW: 此番路，來去無數，我亦在其中。
voicelines.Dispatch Complete - EN: Birds return to their nests, as wilted flowers rejoin fallen leaves.
voicelines.Dispatch Complete - JP: 花は地に帰り、鳥は巣に帰る。
voicelines.Dispatch Complete - KR: 낙화는 잎으로 돌아가고, 날아가는 저 새는 둥지로 돌아가네.

voicelines.Attire Obtained - EN: Thank you for coming... The cherry blossoms are especially beautiful this year, so I couldn't help but want to enjoy this scenery with you.
voicelines.Attire Obtained - JP: 来てくださってありがとうございます……今年のモチヅキザクラはよく咲いているので、どうしても……貴方様と一緒に、この美しい景色を楽しみたいのです。
voicelines.Attire Obtained - KR: 약속대로 나와주셔서 감사해요… 올해의 벚꽃이 정말 예쁘게 펴서 어떻게든… 국장님과 함께 이 아름다운 풍경을 감상하고 싶었어요.
voicelines.Attire Obtained - CN: 感谢您的赴约……今年的望月樱开得很好，所以我无论如何……都想和您一起欣赏这般美丽的景致。
voicelines.Attire Obtained - TW: 感謝您的赴約……今年的望月櫻開得很好，所以我無論如何……都想和您一起欣賞這般美麗的景致。
voicelines.Greeting - EN: You're not late. It was me who arrived early at the thought of seeing you... Don't worry. I was not bored at all, because I was just so happy to meet you soon.
voicelines.Greeting - JP: 貴方様は遅刻などしていません。お会いできると思うと落ち着かず、わたしが早く来てしまっただけなのです……ご安心ください。待っている間も、退屈ではありませんでした。貴方様への想いで心が満たされていましたので。
voicelines.Greeting - KR: 늦게 오신 게 아니에요. 제가 국장님과 만난다는 생각에 참지 못하고 일찍 나온 거예요… 안심하세요. 국장님이랑 만나는 게 너무 기대돼서 기다리는 시간이 전혀 따분하지 않았답니다.
voicelines.Greeting - CN: 您没有迟到，是我一想到要与您见面，就忍不住提前来到这里……您放心，等候的过程并不枯燥，因为我满心期盼着与您相见。
voicelines.Greeting - TW: 您沒有遲到，是我一想到要與您見面，就忍不住提前來到這裡……您放心，等候的過程並不枯燥，因為我滿心期盼著與您相見。
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 1 - EN: Only by choosing the right materials for flower arrangements and wearing the right clothes to view the cherry blossoms, shall one live up to the beauty of nature. So, what do you think of my outfit, Chief?
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 1 - JP: 生け花にふさわしい花材を選ぶのと同じく、花見にふさわしい装いをしなければ、花に申し訳ありませんわ。局長様、この服装はいかがでしょうか？
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 1 - KR: 꽃꽂이할 땐 적절한 꽃을 골라야 하듯 벚꽃 구경을 할 때도 풍경에 어울리는 복장을 입어야 꽃구경을 제대로 할 수 있죠. 국장님, 제 옷차림은 마음에 드세요?
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 1 - CN: 插花应选择合适的花材，赏樱应搭配应景的着装，才算不辜负这场花事。局长，这身装扮您喜欢吗？
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 1 - TW: 插花應選擇合適的花材，賞櫻應搭配應景的著裝，才算不辜負這場花事。局長，這身裝扮您喜歡嗎？
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 2 - EN: Cherry blossoms are also known as the "Flower of Fantasy," because they are as beautiful and illusory as dreams... much like this moment. The time spent with you is as intoxicatingly beautiful as a cherry blossom. Even if it's as fragile and fleeting as a dream, I'm content.
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 2 - JP: 桜は、夢のように儚く美しいことから「夢見草」とも呼ばれています……今この瞬間と同じです。貴方様と過ごす時間は、桜のように酔いしれるほど美しい。たとえ脆く消えやすくても、わたしは……飴のように甘く感じるのです。
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 2 - KR: 벚꽃은 꿈결처럼 비현실적인 아름다움 때문에 '몽견초'라고도 불려요… 마치 지금 이 순간처럼이죠. 국장님과 함께 보낸 시간은 벚꽃처럼 아름다워서 깊이 빠져버리게 돼요. 꿈처럼 덧없이 지나가 버린다 해도… 저는 기꺼이 받아들일 거예요.
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 2 - CN: 樱花又名“梦见草”，因为它似梦境般虚幻美丽……恰如此时此刻。和您一起度过的时光，就像樱花那样美得令人沉醉，即便它也和梦一样脆弱易逝，我都……甘之如饴。
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 2 - TW: 櫻花又名「夢見草」，因為它似夢境般虛幻美麗……恰如此時此刻。和您一起度過的時光，就像櫻花那樣美得令人沉醉，即便它也和夢一樣脆弱易逝，我都……甘之如飴。
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 3 - EN: Come sit next to me. If you don't mind, you can take a nap on my lap. I'll hold the parasol over you...
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 3 - JP: 隣へどうぞ。よろしければ、わたしの膝を枕にして休んでください。傘をさしますので……
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 3 - KR: 제 옆에 앉으세요. 괜찮으시다면 제 무릎에서 잠깐 쉬셔도 돼요. 제가 양산을 들어드릴게요…
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 3 - CN: 请坐到我身边来吧，不介意的话，可以在我膝上小憩一会儿，我来为您撑伞……
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 3 - TW: 請坐到我身邊來吧，不介意的話，可以在我膝上小憩一會，我來為您撐傘……
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 4 - EN: Three days since I last held your hand, now cherry blossoms have covered the land. People often quote this poem to express the passing of time... I wonder when I'll ever get to go out with you again?
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 4 - JP: 「世の中は三日見ぬ間の桜かな」。人々は、時の流れの速さを表現するためにこの句を使います……次に貴方様と出かけられるのは、いつになるのでしょう？
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 4 - KR: 사람들은 항상 '며칠 사이에 세상이 벚꽃으로 뒤덮인다'는 시로 시간의 흐름을 감탄하죠. 언제 또 국장님과 함께할 수 있을까요?
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 4 - CN: 不见方三日，世上满樱花，人们常用这句诗来表示时间易逝……不知下次再与您同游，会是什么时候呢？
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 4 - TW: 不見方三日，世上滿櫻花，人們常用這句詩來表示時間易逝……不知下次再與您同遊，會是什麼時候呢？
voicelines.Idle - EN: Did you see that? The butterfly that just flew by had a petal on its wing...
voicelines.Idle - JP: ご覧になりましたか？先ほど飛んでいた蝶の羽に、花びらが乗っていました……
voicelines.Idle - KR: 보셨어요? 방금 지나간 그 나비, 날개에 꽃잎이 붙어 있었어요…
voicelines.Idle - CN: 您看到了吗？刚才飞过的那只蝴蝶，翅膀上乘了一枚花瓣……
voicelines.Idle - TW: 您看到了嗎？剛才飛過的那隻蝴蝶，翅膀上乘了一枚花瓣……
voicelines.Special Attention - EN: You keep looking at me and not at the cherry blossoms... Do you want to say something to me?
voicelines.Special Attention - JP: 花を見ずに、ずっとわたしをご覧になっていますが……何か言いたいことがあるのですか？
voicelines.Special Attention - KR: 계속 저만 보시고 꽃구경은 안 하시네요… 하고 싶은 말이라도 있으신가요?
voicelines.Special Attention - CN: 您一直盯着我看，却不赏花……是有什么话想对我说吗？
voicelines.Special Attention - TW: 您一直盯著我看，卻不賞花……是有什麼話想對我說嗎？
voicelines.Level Up - EN: Cherry blossoms are willing to bloom passionately for their admirers until the end of their lives, and so do I.
voicelines.Level Up - JP: 桜は見てくれる人のために、命が尽きるまで咲こうとします。わたしも同じです。
voicelines.Level Up - KR: 벚꽃은 꽃구경하는 사람을 위해 삶이 끝날 때까지 활짝 피어준다고 해요. 저도 마찬가지죠.
voicelines.Level Up - CN: 樱花愿意为赏花之人怒放到生命尽头，我也一样。
voicelines.Level Up - TW: 櫻花願意為賞花之人怒放到生命盡頭，我也一樣。
voicelines.Pat Head - EN: ...What's wrong? There are petals on my face? (Blushing) How embarrassing. Thank you for taking them off me.
voicelines.Pat Head - JP: ……どうされましたか？顔に花びらが？わざわざ取ってくださって、ありがとうございます。
voicelines.Pat Head - KR: …왜 그러세요? 제 얼굴에 꽃잎이 붙었나요? …어머, 얼굴에 붙은 줄도 몰랐네요.
voicelines.Pat Head - CN: ……怎么了？我脸上沾到花瓣了？失礼了，您还特意帮我拈下来。
voicelines.Pat Head - TW: ……怎麼了？我臉上沾到花瓣了？失禮了，您還特意幫我拈下來。

voicelines.Attire Obtained - EN: Thank you for coming to enjoy this beautiful view with me... I'm certain that, each night after this night, whether it's bright or dim, wax or wane, I will think of tonight, and the moon we enjoyed together.
voicelines.Attire Obtained - JP: この美しい景色を一緒に楽しんでくださり、ありがとうございます……これから夜が来るたび、どのような月が見えても、必ず今夜貴方様と見た月を思い出すでしょう。
voicelines.Attire Obtained - KR: 이 아름다운 풍경에 함께해 주셔서 감사해요… 이제 밤이 찾아올 때면 흐리든 맑든, 국장님과 함께 구경하던 달을 잊지 못할 거예요.
voicelines.Attire Obtained - CN: 感谢您，愿意陪我过来一起欣赏这美景……我想，以后每当夜幕降临，无论阴晴圆缺，我都一定会想起今晚这轮，与您一起欣赏的月亮。
voicelines.Attire Obtained - TW: 感謝您，願意陪我過來一起欣賞這美景……我想，以後每當夜幕降臨，無論陰晴圓缺，我都一定會想起今晚這輪，與您一起欣賞的月亮。
voicelines.Greeting - EN: The moon hidden in the clouds just peeks out. Do you think it also awaits this romantic encounter with us here and now?
voicelines.Greeting - JP: 雲に隠れていた月が顔を出していますわ。今この瞬間、わたしたちに会いたいと思ったのでしょうか？
voicelines.Greeting - KR: 구름에 가려진 보름달이 때마침 고개를 내미네요. 혹시 보름달도 지금 이 순간 우리를 만나고 싶은 걸까요?
voicelines.Greeting - CN: 隐于云中的月轮恰巧的探出了头，您说，它会不会也想在此刻与我们邂逅？
voicelines.Greeting - TW: 隱於雲中的月輪恰巧的探出了頭，您說，它會不會也想在此刻與我們邂逅？
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 1 - EN: "The moon, alas, is no drinker of wine." Chief, how about I tell you a story unique to a moonlit night?
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 1 - JP: 美酒を飲み終え、盃の底も見えたことですし、月夜だけの物語を語って差し上げましょうか？
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 1 - KR: 좋은 술이네요. 마침 술잔도 비었으니 달이 떠오른 밤에 대한 이야기를 들어보시겠어요?
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 1 - CN: 饮罢琼浆，清樽已经见底，不如让我来为您讲一个独属于月夜的故事吧？
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 1 - TW: 飲罷瓊漿，清樽已經見底，不如讓我來為您講一個獨屬於月夜的故事吧？
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 2 - EN: When I was little, I once heard about a rumor that foxes often transform into humans when the moonlight is bright, and invite the fateful ones to stroll with them... Hmm? Do you think I'm a fox?
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 2 - JP: 幼い頃に聞いた噂では、キツネはたいてい明るい夜に人間の姿に化け、運命の人を夜遊びに誘うそうです……あら？もしかして、わたしをキツネだと思っていらっしゃいますか？
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 2 - KR: 어릴 적, 달빛이 환하게 비추는 날이면 여우가 사람으로 변해 사랑하는 사람을 초대해 함께 밤을 보낸다는 이야기를 들은 적 있어요… 음? 설마 저를 사람으로 변한 여우라고 생각하시는 건가요?
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 2 - CN: 我幼时曾听过一个传闻，狐狸大多会在清光皎皎之时化为人形，邀请有缘人与之夜游……嗯？您难道认为我是狐狸变的么？
voicelines.Ordinary Contact 2 - TW: 我幼時曾聽過一個傳聞，狐狸大多會在清光皎皎之時化為人形，邀請有緣人與之夜遊……嗯？您難道認為我是狐狸變的嗎？
voicelines.Idle - EN: Alone are the leaves and moon. Alone I hum the wistful tune.
voicelines.Idle - JP: 紅葉散り、月夜を彷徨う、酒の詩。
voicelines.Idle - KR: 가을 잎과 달의 그림자는 함께 하지 못하고, 찻잎을 음미하던 노래도 가을바람에 쓸쓸히 읊조리네.
voicelines.Idle - CN: 秋叶月影无相伴，清冽茶歌亦独吟。
voicelines.Idle - TW: 秋葉月影無相伴，清冽茶歌亦獨吟。
voicelines.Annoyed - EN: Emm, is it getting windy? Allow me, Chief. I don't want you to catch a cold.
voicelines.Annoyed - JP: 風が強くなってきましたか？もう一枚羽織ってください。
voicelines.Annoyed - KR: 바람이 부나요? 좀 더 따뜻하게 입으세요.
voicelines.Annoyed - CN: 起风了？您也要记得添件衣服呀。
voicelines.Annoyed - TW: 起風了？您也要記得添件衣服呀。
voicelines.Special Attention - EN: If you only gaze at the moon, you might overlook the scenery that truly matters.
voicelines.Special Attention - JP: 月を見る時、あの清らかな美しい光だけを眺めていると、本当に気に留めなければならない景色を見逃してしまうかもしれませんよ。
voicelines.Special Attention - KR: 달구경을 하다 보면 달의 밝은 빛에 넋이 나가 정작 마음에 드는 경치를 놓칠 수도 있죠~
voicelines.Special Attention - CN: 赏月若只是一直注视着那一轮清辉，或许会忽视真正令人在意的景色哦～
voicelines.Special Attention - TW: 賞月若只是一直注視著那一輪清輝，或許會忽視真正令人在意的景色哦～
voicelines.Level Up - EN: In the sameness of all nights, your kind words made this one incomparable.
voicelines.Level Up - JP: 夜の美しさには限りがありますが、貴方様がわたしに向けてくださる賛辞は比類のないものです。
voicelines.Level Up - KR: 국장님께서 제게 주시는 찬사는 밤의 아름다움과 비교할 수 없을 만큼 값지답니다.
voicelines.Level Up - CN: 夜色之美有限，但您对我的赞美却是无可比拟的。
voicelines.Level Up - TW: 夜色之美有限，但您對我的讚美卻是無可比擬的。
